text: welcome to daily video vocabulary a dose
of daily new English phrases and words
brought to you by let's store
podcast.com
hello English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 80 in today's
episode I have a new idiom for you the
last straw let's find out what it means
and how you can use it in your daily
conversation the last straw you may have
dealt with something unpleasant for a
very long time but as things worse and
you couldn't accept or tolerate it any
longer the last straw is an idiom which
basically means the final problem that
makes someone lose their temper or
patience if an event that is followed by
a series of bad experiences it makes you
feel you can't tolerate it anymore
and you finally decide to leave it or do
something to change it you call such an
event the last straw in other words you
are very angry you've exhausted all your
patience and tolerance and you have had
enough you can no longer put up with it
it is the final irritation that exceeds
your capacity of dealing with something
that you have been tolerating for a very
long time for example a teacher
tolerates her notorious students and
keeps warning him but when he back
answers her in front of the whole class
it is the last straw as she no longer
has the capacity to deal with
impatiently and gets his parents to meet
her okay now that you know what this
idiom means
let's take a look at some example
sentences to see how you can use it in
your daily conversation
example one the car the Terek bought
last month for to break and battery
problems but last week's engine trouble
was the last straw and he finally
decided to sell the car example til
Richard had been unhappy at work for a
long time the last straw came when he
was refused to promotion and he finally
quit his job example 3 Brian had a lot
of problems with the hotel service but
when the laundry person messed up with
his favorite shirt
it was the last straw and he moved out
the next morning example for an
international trade ban could be the
last straw for the country's foreign
exchange growth rates example 5 Gloria
compromised being in a troubled marriage
for years when she found out her husband
had cheated on her it was the last straw
and she ended her marriage example 6
after repeated warnings lisa continued
reporting late to work it was the last
straw when she absconded without
informing the management fired her from
the job example 7 the production team
had been waiting for the actress on the
sets when she didn't turn up it was the
last straw and they decided to get a new
actress on board
example 8 Mary had always been rude and
nasty to William but it was the last
straw
when she insulted him at a party he
could no longer accept her behavior
example 9
besides being rebellious Crees was a
chain-smoker
when father found him returning home
drunk late at night it was the last
straw
and he wasn't allowed to party for many
months that's the end of today's episode
have you faced something unpleasant that
made you feel it was the last straw
kindly share your experiences in the
comment box below this video thank you
for watching us do watch all the
episodes of daily video vocabulary to
make your English communication skills
better do subscribe to our Channel and
stay updated with all the latest lessons
I will see you again tomorrow with a new
word or an idiom till then bye and take
care
